Caption: Figure 1: Five dimensions of a social survey. Red and blue lines indicate over- and under-proportional relationships between categories of adjacent axes by visualizing the measure Lift [1]. The visualization shows that people being proud of their nation’s army tend to be proud about national scientific and technical achievements as well.
Figure 3: Arrows visualize the difference between expected and ac- tual frequencies.

Figure 2: Relating the category ”female” to four other dimensions. Orange bars show the percentages of entries per category and arrows indicate the over- and under-proportional relationships. As one result, women left questions concerning pride unanswered more often than men.
